Ohio Scholarships


*Grand Lodge Of Free & Accepted Masons Of Ohio
Scholarship for GRADUATING HIGH SCHOOL SENIORS planning to attend FRANKLIN UNIVERSITY full-time in the fall of their graduation year. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. In addition to application, students must submit an essay, one letter of recommendation, and the completed Guidance Counselor Certification Form. Awards are non-renewable. Award amount ranges $500-$1,500. Contact Office of Student Services for more information and/or application. more...

*Scholarships
Various scholarships for incoming freshmen, undergraduate and graduate students at the UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY. Due dates, award amounts and number of awards vary with each scholarship. Contact the Admissions or Financial Aid Office for more information and/or application. more...

1809 Club Kregar Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Miami University in Ohio, majoring in Chemistry. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

1978 Senior Class Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for college seniors enrolled full-time at Ohio University. Consideration given to academic achievement and merit. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

1981 Htc Anonymous Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Ohio University Honors Tutorial College. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

50 Men & Women Of Toledo Scholarship
Scholarship for African-American college freshmen enrolled full-time at the University of Toledo. Students must be Toledo, Ohio area high school graduates. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

50Th Year Class Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Tiffin University who are children or grandchildren of TU alumni. Selection is based on academic achievement. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

A. Alberta Holden Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for female undergraduate student attending Miami University in Ohio, majoring in Office Management. Applicant must have academic scholarship and financial need. Due date and award amount varies. more...

A. Blair Knapp Memorial Scholarship (B)
Scholarship for undergraduate students who are athletes attending Denison University. Preference is given to basketball players with financial need. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

A. Dane Ellis Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Miami University in Ohio, majoring in History. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

A. Douglas Freehafer Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate sophomore or junior student attending Ashland University full-time, majoring in Business. Applicant must have professional promise and a minimum 3.5 GPA. Due date and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

A. Glenn & Essie Garber Carpenter Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for members of the Ashland-based Brethren Church who are undergraduate students attending Ashland University full-time. Applicant must have an above-average academic record and demonstrate qualities of character and Christian principles. Due date and award amount varies. more...

A. Jackson & Sally K. Smith Endowed Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for Ohio, Indiana, or Lenawee, Hillsdale, or Monroe County, Michigan residents who are college juniors, seniors, or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Toledo College of Arts and Sciences majoring in Physics and Astronomy. Students must be U.S. citizens. Preference given to students who demonstrate citizenship and are active in the community and participate in minor sports. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Renewable. more...

A. Martin & Ruth Zucker Memorial Award
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Toledo Judith Herb College of Education. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

A. Robert Rogers Memorial Scholarship
The A. Robert Rogers Memorial Scholarship is open to Kent State University graduate students in the School of Library and Information Science. more...

A.E. & E.V. Miller Endowed Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Walsh University who are majoring in Nursing or Pre-Medicine. Selection based on the WU Financial Aid Application, the FAFSA, and academic record. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Renewable. more...

A.F. & A.A. Bostwick Scholarship
Scholarship for male undergraduate students attending Denison University. Applicants must have financial need. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

A.L. Freedlander Foundation Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for residents of North Central Ohio who are undergraduate students attending Ashland University full-time. Applicants must have academic achievement and demonstrated financial need. Preference given to students in the immediate Ashland vicinity. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

A.S.M.E. Award Of Merit
Scholarship for American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) students active members who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Toledo College of Engineering majoring in Mechanical Engineering. Students must demonstrate participation in ASME functions. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Aa Green Family Business Scholarship
Scholarship to provide an opportunity to local students wishing to further their education at BGSU.
Eligibility: Undergraduate student.
Criteria: Full-time student.
Enrolled in the Allen W. and Carol M. Schmidthorst College of Business.
Shall have 3.0 GPA or higher.
Shall demonstrate high school/university and community leadership and be of high moral character.
Shall be graduate(s) from Bowling Green High School, Wood County, Ohio. more...

Aa Green Family Education Scholarship
Scholarship provides Scholarship opportunity to local students wishing to further their education at BGSU.
Eligibility: Undergraduate student
Criteria: Full-time student.
Enrolled in College of Education & Human Development.
Shall have 3.0 GPA or higher.
Shall demonstrate high school/university and community leadership and be of high moral character.
Graduate(s) from Bowling Green High School, Wood County, Ohio.
Renewable as long as current or past recipients submit another request and continue to meet all criteria. more...

Abb Industrial Systems Pulp & Paper Division Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Miami University in Ohio, majoring in Paper Science Engineering. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Abbie Hawk Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for juniors, seniors or graduate students attending the University of Akron who are majoring in Child or Family Welfare. Selection based on academic achievement, financial need and potential. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Abbott Fund Endowed Scholarship In Biological & Physical Science
Annual award for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Columbus State Community College. A personal statement and essay must be included with application packet. more...

Abbott Fund Endowed Scholarship In Sport & Exercise Science
Annual award for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Columbus State Community College in the Sports and Exercise program. Students must have a minimum 2.75 CGPA and earned a minimum of 45 credit hours with a minimum of 20 credit hours in the program. A personal statement and essay must be included with application packet. more...

Abby Lynn Hettel Memorial Scholarship
The Abby Lynn Hettel Memorial Scholarship was established for the purpose of providing an annual award to a qualified full-time undergraduate student in the School of Human Movement, Sport and Leisure Studies in the College of Education and Human Development.
Eligibility:
Must a full-time, undergraduate student;
Must be majoring in Recreation or Tourism programs;
Must be a rising junior or senior;
Must have a minimum GPA of 3.0.
Preference will be given to students who are members of Delta Gamma Sorority and/or are peer facilitators in a campus program for first year students.
Financial need may be considered. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Ohio University. Students must demonstrate academic achievement, promise, ability in mathematics, statistics, and quantitative methods related to business economics. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Annual award for undergraduate Brethren student attending Ashland University full-time, training for the ministry. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Scholarship for male undergraduate students attending Denison University who are preparing for the Baptist Ministry. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Academic & Leadership Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming or current undergraduate students attending Franklin University. Applicants must be full-time students and have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Academic Accomplishment Scholarship For Minority Students
Scholarship for minority incoming freshmen students attending Marietta College in Ohio, with outstanding academic promise. Selection is based on high school records and curriculum, scores on national examinations and potential leadership for Marietta. Number of awards varies. Renewable; maintain 2.5 GPA and full-time enrollment. more...

Academic Honor Scholarships

The Academic Honors Scholarship is available to entering students at Bluffton University. You must demonstrate high academic achievement to be considered for this award. more...

Academic Investment In Math And Science (Aims)
The purpose of the AIMS Program is to increase the number of women-identified students and students of color who graduate from BGSU with degrees in Science, Technology, Engineering & Math (STEM), and go on to earn terminal degrees, and become national and international leaders in these fields.
For more information about the AIMS program please visit the AIMS website. more...

Academic Scholarship - Heidelberg University
The Academic Scholarship is available to entering freshmen students at Heidelberg University. Scholarships are awarded based on a point system; you must have a point value of 5-6 to be eligible for this award. more...

Academy Of Medicine Of Toledo & Lucas County Alliance Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Toledo College of Health Science and Human Service majoring in the Health Care field. Students must have financial need and completed one full year of study in the health care field. A FAFSA must be submitted by April 1st. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Accountancy Scholarships
Scholarship for full- and part-time undergraduate students attending Wright State University majoring in Accounting. Applicants must have demonstrated academic achievement, leadership and extracurricular activities and have a minimum 3.2 GPA and complete eight hours of principles-level accounting coursework. A personal essay must be included with application packet. Number of awards may vary. more...

Akiko Kawano Jones Japanese Study Abroad Scholarship
The Akiko Kawano Jones Japanese Study Abroad Scholarship was established to provide support to students who participate in the Japanese Study Abroad experience.
Criteria:
Must be either an Asian Studies major, Asian Studies minor or Japanese studies minor;
Must have completed a minimum of 2 semester of Japanese language courses at BGSU;
Must demonstrate financial need as determined by FAFSA;
Must have at least one semester remaining at BGSU before graduation after the semester of the study abroad experience. more...

Undergraduate student of color.

Alga D. Peg Weaver 4-H Scholarship
Annual award for an Ohio resident who is a high school senior and current 4-H member that is planning to enroll as a freshman at The Ohio State University in the College of Human Ecology. Student must maintain a minimum 2.0 GPA. Selection will be based on: 10% for potential for success; 10% for financial need; 40% on 4-H leadership activities; 20% on major 4-H honors; 15% on 4-H community service/citizenship; 5% on personal 4-H story. more...

Alissa Czisny '09 Entrepreneurship Scholarship
In honor of her dedication, hard work and drive to complete her BGSU education while competing at the highest level of international figure skating.
Eligibility and Selection Criteria: Incoming freshman or returning sophomores.
Enrolled in entrepreneurship minor in the Allen W. and Carol M. Schmidthorst College of Business.
Pursuing entrepreneurial career.
Pursuing any specialization in the Allen W. and Carol M. Schmidthorst College of Business.
Significant leadership experience.
Maintain 3.25 cumulative GPA in high school and minimum ACT of 22 or equivalent.
Participation in personal interview.
Financial need is a preference.
Non-renewable. more...

Preference will be given to applicants from Franklin County. Selection will be based on: 10% for potential for success; 10% for financial need; 40% on 4-H leadership activities; 20% on major 4-H honors; 15% on 4-H community service/citizenship; 5% on personal 4-H story. more...

Scholarship recognizes a senior in Liberal Arts who is judged by University committee to have exemplified the highest personal qualities or intellectual and cultural endeavor and attainment during his/her college career.
Eligibility: Senior
Criteria: Rank in upper ten percent of his/her class.
Intellectual curiosity, alertness, originality, discrimination, and honesty.
Course program which include studies stressing ideas and philosophy.
Personal poise, refinement, friendliness, tolerance, tact and emotional stability.
Evidence of positive aims, etc.
Physical energy, neatness, enthusiasm and good bearing. more...

Must have a minimum 3.0 GPA;
Must demonstrate financial need as determined by FAFSA.

Financial need

Must be gainfully employed 10 hours per week

Annual award for an Ohio resident who is a high school senior and current 4-H member that is planning to enroll in as a freshman, autumn quarter in the College of Human Ecology at the Ohio State University or any of its regional campuses. Selection will be based on: 10% for potential for success; 10% for financial need; 40% on 4-H leadership activities; 20% on major 4-H honors; 15% on 4-H community service/citizenship; 5% on personal 4-H story. more...

earn and maintain a 3.0 GPA or better;
write and submit an essay up to 500 words describing how his or her college experience has affected his or her own career aspirations, outlook on life, and how they foresee themselves giving back to their community; obtain a recommendation from a faculty member; demonstrate leadership outside the classroom through participation in a student organization, or part-time job. more...

Beverly A. Koenig Scholarship
The Beverly A. Koenig Scholarship was established for the purpose of providing Scholarships to students
majoring in the field of education.
Be a full-time, undergraduate student with a major in the field of education;
Be a resident of Henry County, Ohio*;
Have a high school GPA of 3.0 or greater (if a first-year student) or have a cumulative college GPA of
3.0 or greater (if other than a first-year student); and
Demonstrate financial need.
*If there are no qualified applicants from Henry County, selection shall be made using the remaining criteria.
The Scholarship is not automatically renewable, however past recipients are eligible to receive more than once,
provided they continue to meet the eligibility criteria. more...

The BGSU Board of Trustees Leadership Scholarship was established to award scholarships to BGSU students who exemplify leadership potential and to demonstrate the support of one of the Universitys priorities in promoting a culture of leadership across campus.
Eligibility:
Must be a rising sophomore, junior or senior;
Must be registered full-time, in good academic standing;
Must have a minimum 3.0 GPA;
Must exhibit leadership characteristics and potential.
Must be available for an in-person interview in early May. more...

Eligibility:
Must have a minimum 2.50 cumulative college GPA or 3.00 cumulative high school GPA;
Must demonstrate financial need;
Must be enrolled at BGSU Firelands. more...

Scholarship recognizes outstanding level of participation and commitment to furthering the mission of the University through their work at Telefund.
Criteria:
Must have been employed, in good standing, at Telefund Center in Development Office.
Minimum 2.5 GPA
Candidates must demonstrate financial need. more...

Bob Evans Farms, Inc. Scholarship
Annual award for an Ohio resident who is a high school senior and current 4-H member that is planning to enroll Autumn Quarter in the College of Food, Agricultural, and Environmental Sciences at The Ohio State University. Selection will be based on: 10% for potential for success; 10% for financial need; 40% on 4-H leadership activities; 20% on major 4-H honors; 15% on 4-H community service/citizenship; 5% on personal 4-H story. more...

Must be a full time student enrolled in a program leading to teacher certification;
Must have a minimum GPA of 3.5, and exhibit the potential to become an outstanding educator;
Selection will be made on the basis of the following criteria, which is listed in priority order 1) Scholarship, 2) leadership, 3) service to the College, University and/or community; 4) professional potential & 5) financial need more...

Butterfield Washington Center Scholarship
The William and Susan Butterfield scholarship will make it possible for a student to acquire perspective and experience in their field of study beyond the classroom through participation in the Washington Center program.
Eligibility and Selection Criteria:
Undergraduate students who have completed minimum 30 credit hours;
Maintained enrollment as a full-time student;
In good academic standing;
Minimum accumulative 2.75 GPA (as required by Washington Center Internship program);
Demonstrate an ongoing record of co-curricular involvement and future promise;
Shall complete the Washington Center Internship (TWC) application process;
Must submit TWC application no later than the deadline date set by Washington Center for summer term.
Non-renewable. more...

C. Mccambridge Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship provides an annual award to a qualified full-time undergraduate student majoring in voice in the College of Musical Arts.
Criteria:
Must be a rising sophomore, junior or senior majoring in voice.
Minimum 3.0 GPA.
If no voice student qualifies, students majoring in piano may be considered. If no piano student qualifies, any music major may be considered.
Preference will be given to students who are Fostoria, Ohio residents.
Evidence of financial need as determined by FAFSA shall be considered as a determining factor only if it applies to a candidate equally qualified in other regards, especially talent and scholastic achievement.
Renewable as long as current recipient submits another application form and continues to meet all criteria. more...

Charles & Gwyenna Lifer 4-H Scholarship
Annual award for an Ohio resident who is a high school senior and current 4-H member that is planning to enroll in the fall at The Ohio State University main campus in Columbus with a major in the area of Agriculture or Natural Resources. Secondary eligibility will be given to seniors planning to attend the Agricultural Technical Institute (ATI) located in Wooster, Ohio. Preference will be given to applicants from Richland, Knox and Monroe counties. Selection will be based on: 10% for potential for success; 10% for financial need; 40% on 4-H leadership activities; 20% on major 4-H honors; 15% on 4-H community service/citizenship; 5% on personal 4-H story. more...

Applicants must have a minimum 3.3 and demonstrate exemplary musical stewardship and Christian character. Recipients are nominated and selected by department faculty; no application is necessary. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Charles W. And Donna E. Foss Science Scholarship
The Charles W. and Donna E. Foss Science Scholarship was established to assist students majoring in one of the hard sciences or who are planning to teach the hard sciences in schools.
Eligibility:
Must be a rising sophomore, junior or senior;
Must be majoring in the hard sciences OR be training to teach the hard sciences in schools. (Hard sciences include Integrated Sciences, Chemistry, Physics or Biology.)
Must have a minimum 2.50 cumulative GPA;
Must demonstrate financial need by submitting the FAFSA and show need as determined on FAFSA.
First preference shall be given to students from Ottawa or Sandusky counties in Ohio.
Previous recipient(s) may be awarded the scholarship in consecutive years. more...

Eligibility: Full-time undergraduate.
Criteria: Pursuing a major in chemistry education or comprehensive science education.
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Academic excellence
Commitment to enter teaching profession
Preference given to students with financial need. more...

Must be a currently qualified scholarship applicant in accordance w/ current cadet command regulations, but no a full scholarship recipient, in the BGSU Army or Air Force ROTC program;
Must demonstrate financial need;
Must currently be enrolled in a biological or physical science or any specialization within Applied Health Science;
Minimum 2.5 GPA;
Must have passed the current physical fitness exam;
Must have demonstrated leadership qualities, a positive attitude, and dedication to service to the community.
Renewable as long as current or past recipients submit another request and continue to meet all criteria. more...

Annual award for an Ohio resident who is a current member of Collegiate 4-H at the Ohio State University main campus and has paid the annual dues to the OSU Collegiate 4-H Club (dues are $6/quarter or $15/year). Selection is based on: 60% on Collegiate 4-H club activities; 25% on how Collegiate 4-H has enhanced your college experience; 10% on extracurricular activities; and 5% on academic achievements. Award amount varies. more...

Cunningham 4-H Leadership Scholarship
Annual award for an Ohio resident who is a college sophomore, junior or senior currently enrolled at the Ohio State University main campus (in Columbus, Ohio) that plans to study in any area. Preference will be given to students currently enrolled in the College of Food, Agricultural and Environmental Sciences and/or the College of Human Ecology. Student must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Selection will be based on: 20% for 4-H activities; 3% on 4-H Leadership; 10% on academic achievements; 30% college leadership; and 10% on students personal statement. more...

Cynthia Collin Stong Marine Biology Scholarship
Scholarship intended to provide support to Marine Biology students participating in field studies.
Eligibility: Preference given to rising sophomores and juniors; must be enrolled in the Marine and Aquatic Biology Specialization.
Criteria: Preference given to rising sophomores and juniors; must be enrolled in the Marine and Aquatic Biology Specialization.
Must be participating in approved field programs at marine stations; freshwater stations will be considered.
Preference given to students planning to take courses during the entire ten-week summer field program at The University of Southern Mississippis Gulf Coast Research Laboratory in Ocean Springs, Mississippi, which is affiliated with Bowling Green State University.
To be considered an approved off-campus field program, it must provide a course grade and credit that will count toward the recipients graduation requirements.
Must submit names and email addresses of two faculty members willing to provide letters of recommendation on applicants behalf.
Must submit written final report and make formal presentation to current and/or potential BGSU marine biology students about the benefit of their experience. more...

David And Lisa O'brien Cleveland Scholarship
The David and Lisa OBrien Cleveland Scholarship was established to support students from the Cleveland Metropolitan School District who have strong academic potential and great financial need. This scholarship will provide funding for non-tuition expenses, such as room and board, for students receiving grants and other scholarships to cover tuition and fees.
Eligibility:
Must be scheduled to graduate from a Cleveland Metropolitan School District high school;
Must be an incoming freshman;
Must demonstrate financial need as determined by FAFSA;
Must have a minimum 2.75 high school GPA.
Awards are renewable to up to three (3) additional years while pursuing an undergraduate degree provided the recipient maintains a minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA and continues to demonstrate financial need. more...

Dean William F. Schmeltz Scholarship
The Andrews Family Trust established the Dean William F. Schmeltz
Scholarship in 2010 to honor Dean Schmeltz for his leadership in the development of the
Allen W. and Carol M. Schmidthorst College of Business at Bowling Green State University. The Andrews Family
Trust wishes to honor Dean Schmeltz in this way because of his support of Dr. Charles Andrews
when he was returning to complete his graduate degree. Dr. Andrews had significant
commitments outside of the classroom as he was married and raising four children. Because of
this support, Dr. Andrews was able to go on to complete his Ph.D. and have a very successful
academic career. Dr. Andrews career was truly inspired by Dean Schmeltz.
Eligibility and Selection Criteria
Recipient must be full-time student in Master of Business Administration or Master of Accountancy program;
Recipient must demonstrate education-related financial need. The student must complete the FAFSA and show need as reported on the SAR;
Recipient must have a minimum G.P.A. of 3.25.;
The recipient shall not be eligible for any employer reimbursement for educational costs;
First preference shall be given to a recipient who has held his or her undergraduate degree for at least one year prior to returning to further his or her education;
Preference shall be given to a student who holds significant personal commitments outside of the educational environment. more...

Schmidthorst College of Business with a degree specialization towards Business Analytics and Intelligence. This is the area of focus that most closely relates to the academic area of oversight that Dr. Mott oversaw during his years as a member of the faculty, including his years as Department Chair.

Be working towards a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration (BSBA) with Allen W. and Carol M. Schmidthorst College of Business;
Have a degree specialization in Business Analytics and Intelligence;

Maintain good academic standing;

Students must be working on either thesis research or graduate research. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Dr. Martha Gesling Weber Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for Fairfield County, Ohio residents who are undergraduate students attending an Ohio state university pursuing studies in Education. Applicants must have graduated from a Fairfield County high school and have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Preference is given to students attending Bowling Green State University. Consideration will be given to students course schedule and involvement in elementary or secondary schools. Students must file the FAFSA. Award amount may vary. more...

Dr. Martin Luther King Scholarship
Scholarship for African-American undergraduate students enrolled part- or full-time at the University of Toledo. Students must demonstrate academic achievement, community service, professional goals, be U.S. citizens, and completed 30 credit hours. An interview is required. A FAFSA must be submitted by April 1st. Number of awards and award amount may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Falcon Achievement Award
Falcon Achievement Award is a renewable scholarship given to incoming students. The requirements are:
High school cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better
Must have submitted FAFSA by January 15, 2022
Plus, you have to be a first-generation college student OR display a commitment to diversity
Must submit an application for admission, credentials and FAFSA by January 15. more...

Falcon Outfitters Scholarship
The Falcon Outfitters Scholarship is open to all incoming first-year, first-time students who live in Wood, Lucas or Hancock counties in Ohio.
Eligibility:
Must have a minimum 2.75 high school GPA;
Must demonstrate financial need thru the completion of the FAFSA
Must be a first-time incoming freshman student;
Must live in Wood, Lucas or Hancock counties in Ohio. more...

Scholarship for families with two or more siblings both attending Ashland University. The value of the grant is 50 percent of the tuition which is split equally between the students. Recipients may also qualify for other non need-based scholarships with a maximum equal to tuition. Due date, number of awards and exact award amount varies. Renewable; maintain minimum 2.5 GPA. more...

Honors Learning Community Engagement Scholarship
The Honors Learning Communities Engagement Scholarship recognizes engagement with the Honors Learning Community (HLC). Students who are engaged in the HLC and those who are in leadership roles within or related to the HLC in support of the mission of the community, the Honors College, and critical thinking are invited to apply. This scholarship is for those students who find ways to give back to the community and those who have strong potential for continued engagement in the future.
Eligibility:
Must be in good standing with the Honors College;
Must be enrolled in the HLC;
Priority will be given to students who demonstrate involvement in activities that promote and support the work of the HLC, such as Honors Fellows, understanding and discussing the community and its benefits, serving as an RA in Founders Residence Hall, membership in other Honors affiliated organizations, Honors Student Association (HSA), or as an Honors Ambassador. Attendance at events and/or programming will also be considered. more...

Preference given to students from the Toledo, Ohio area. A FAFSA must be submitted by April 1st. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Scholarship for graduate students enrolled full-time at Ohio University College of Education. Students must be alumna of the Ohio University Chapter of Pi Beta Phi Sorority; or an alumna of any collegiate chapter of Phi Beta Phi Sorority admitted to the Ohio University College of Education graduate program; or any female graduate student in the College of Education. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

John L. Ryant Memorial 4-H Agriculture Scholarship
Annual award for an Ohio resident who is a high school senior and current or former 4-H member that is planning to enroll in the College of Food, Agricultural, and Environmental Sciences at the Ohio State University. Preference will be given to applicants from Delaware County. Selection will be based on: 10% for potential for success; 10% for financial need; 40% on 4-H leadership activities; 20% on major 4-H honors; 15% on 4-H community service/citizenship; 5% on personal 4-H story. more...

John M. & Elise A. Valentine Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student-athlete attending Ashland University full-time, who is a member of the varsity football team, majoring in Sports Science. Applicant must have good social and academic standing (minimum 2.5 GPA). Consideration given for financial need, but not a determining factor. First preference given to descendants of the Valentine family. Due date and award amount varies. more...

John M. Ashbrook Scholar Program
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Ashland University who have been accepted to the Scholars Program. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA to apply. Once admitted to the program, Scholars are required to minor in Public Affairs but are free to major in the discipline of their choice. Attendance at Ashbrook Center events is essential. To apply, student must complete application, write a brief essay, submit 2 letters of reference, as described in the application form, and attend an interview. Applications are considered year round; review and selection begins January 15. Award amount is $1,000/semester. more...

Joseph C. Weger Family Honors Scholarship
The Joseph C. Weger Family Honors Scholarship was established to provide scholarship support to Honors students who are studying in new and emerging data and analytics fields.
Eligibility:
Must be enrolled within the Honors College;
Must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5;
Must have completed 20 Honors credits, earning As or Bs in each class;
Must be studying within a data science, analytics or computational science discipline.
Preference will be given to students with majors of Computer Science, Software Engineering, Applied Statistics and Operations Research, Business Analytics and Intelligence, and Information Systems.
Preference will also be given to students who are pursuing or on track to complete their Honors project. more...

Must be a resident of Dayton, Ohio and a graduate of a Dayton Public School;

Annual award for an Ohio resident who is a high school senior and current 4-H member that is planning to enroll as a freshman at The Ohio State University in the College of Human Ecology. Selection will be based on: 10% for potential for success; 10% for financial need; 40% on 4-H leadership activities; 20% on major 4-H honors; 15% on 4-H community service/citizenship; 5% on personal 4-H story. more...

Preference will be given to Richland County applicants. Selection will be based on: 10% for potential for success; 10% for financial need; 40% on 4-H leadership activities; 20% on major 4-H honors; 15% on 4-H community service/citizenship; 5% on personal 4-H story. more...

Owens Corning Building Opportunities Scholarship
The Owens Corning Building Opportunities Scholarship supports the recruitment and retention of students from historically marginalized groups interested in pursuing undergraduate degrees in Construction Management or Architecture and Environmental Design, and other majors in the building sciences field in BGSUs School of the Built Environment.
Eligibility:
Must be an incoming freshman;
Must be enrolled in or have a declared major within the School of Built Environment in the College of Technology, Architecture, and Applied Engineering;
Must be in good academic standing.
Preference will be given to students from historically marginalized groups.
Additional preference will be given to students who demonstrate financial need as determined by FAFSA.
Awards are eligible for renewal for up to 3 years while pursuing an undergraduate degree, provided the recipient maintains good academic standing and remains in the School of Built Environment. more...

Owens Corning Foundation Diamante Scholarship
Scholarship for Latino-Hispanic undergraduate students enrolled part- or full-time at the University of Toledo. Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and be U.S. citizens. Preference given to full-time students. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Applications are available at the Zane State Foundation office and the guidance offices of local high schools in Guernsey, Muskingum, or Noble counties. more...

Pal A. & Ethel I. Smith 4-H Scholarship
Annual award for an Ohio resident who is a high school senior and current or former 4-H member that is planning to enroll as a freshman at The Ohio State University, ATI or any of its regional campuses, in the College of Food, Agricultural, and Environmental Sciences, including the School of Natural Resources, to pursue an education in Farming or Agriculture. Selection will be based on: 10% for potential for success; 10% for financial need; 40% on 4-H leadership activities; 20% on major 4-H honors; 15% on 4-H community service/citizenship; 5% on personal 4-H story. more...

Pilkington-Libbey-Owens-Ford Co. Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Toledo College of Engineering. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Pittsburgh Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for Pittsburgh area resident who is a graduating high school senior accepted to attend Ashland University full-time. Applicant should have academic achievement and financial need. Recipients are selected by the Financial Aid Office, however, Pittsburgh area alumni may recommend names of prospective students for consideration. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Pixley Scholarships
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending the University of Akron who are majoring in Music, Literature or Speech. Selection based on academic achievement and potential. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Plain Dealer Charities Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Cuyahoga, Lake, Geauga, Portage, Summit, Medina, or Lorain counties, Ohio who are graduating high school seniors planning to attend Case Western Reserve University majoring in Business Management or Print Journalism. Applicants must be in the upper 20 percent of their high school class and must attain ACT or SAT scores in the upper 25th percentile. Candidates must have financial need. more...

Plain Dealer Charities Scholarship
The Plain Dealer Charities Scholarship is available to entering freshmen who plan to major in journalism or business management at Cleveland State University. You must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and graduate of a high school in Cuyhoga, Lake, Geauga, Portage, Summit, Medina, or Lorain counties to be eligible for this award. more...

Pleasant View Baptist Church Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Cedarville University in Ohio. Preference given to members of Pleasant View Baptist Church. Applicants should complete the FAFSA application to qualify for this award. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Polymer Engineering Award Fund
Scholarship for graduate students attending the University of Akron who are enrolled in the College of Polymer Science and Polymer Engineering. Selection based on academic achievement, potential and contribution to the department. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Porter Wright Morris & Arthur Llp-Ralph K. Frasier Scholarship (Columbus)
Annual award for minority first-year law students enrolled at Ohio State University Mortiz College of Law or the Capital University Law School. Selection based on work experience leadership abilities, academic achievement, test scores, an essay, and involvement in extracurricular and community activities. A summer associate clerkship is also included in award. Nonrenewable. more...

Pre-Medical Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Toledo College of Arts and Sciences majoring in Pre-Medicine. Students must demonstrate financial need and academic achievement. A FAFSA must be submitted by April 1st. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

President's Scholarship - Marietta College
The President's Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Marietta College. You must demonstrate academic merit and participate in the Pioneer Scholars competition to be eligible for this award. more...

President's Scholarship - Tiffin University
The President's Scholarship is available to transfer students at Tiffin University. Transfer students must have a GPA between 3.5 and 3.74 to be considered for this award. more...

Presidential Pharmacy Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming freshmen attending Ohio Northern University full-time majoring in Pharmacy. Applicants must have a minimum 3.8 GPA, minimum SAT score of 1360 or ACT score of 31 and an invitation from the college to apply. Renewable. more...

Presidential Scholars Award
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolled full-time at Ohio University Athens Campus. Students must rank in the top 20% of the graduating class and have an ACT score of 32-36 or SAT score of 1400-1600. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Renewable. more...

Presidential Scholars Award - Otterbein University
The Presidential Scholars Award is available to entering freshmen at Otterbein University. You must demonstrate significant academic achievement to be considered for this award. more...

Presidential Scholarship
The Presidential Scholarship is available to junior and senior students at the University of Rio Grande and Rio Grande Community College. You must have a minimum 3.51 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Presidential Scholarship - Capital University
The Presidential Scholarship is available to entering freshmen and transfer students at Capital University. Selection is based on your high school record and ACT / SAT scores. Transfer students are selected based on collegiate academic performance. more...

Presidential Scholarship - Heidelberg University
The Presidential Scholarship is available to entering freshmen students at Heidelberg University. Scholarships are awarded based on a point system; you must have a point value of 9-10 to be eligible for this award. more...

Presidential Scholarship - Mccn
The Presidential Scholarship is available to students at Mount Carmel College of Nursing. You must have a minimum 25 ACT score, have a minimum GPA of 3.5 and demonstrate leadership and community service involvement to qualify for this award. more...

Presidential Scholarship - Ohio Northern University
The Presidential Scholarship is available to entering first - year students at Ohio Northern University. You must have a minimum 29 ACT score (or SAT equivalent) and a minimum 3.5 GPA to qualify for this award. more...

Presidential Scholarship - University Of Akron
The Presidential Scholarship is available to incoming freshmen at the University of Akron. Recipients are selected from students who are considered for, but do not receive, a Scholarship for Excellence. You must be an Ohio resident, have a minimum 3.5 GPA, rank in the top ten percent of your high school class and have an ACT/SAT score of 28/1230 to qualify for this renewable award. more...

Presidential Scholarship - Wilmington College
The Presidential Scholarship is available to incoming freshmen at Wilmington College. You must have an ACT score between 22 and 36, an SAT score between 1020 and 1600 and a minimum 3.0 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Scholarship for freshmen enrolling at John Carroll University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and strong SAT or ACT scores. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Selection is based on academics, including high school performance (GPA, class rank), strength of high school curriculum, involvement in school and community activities, evidence of leadership and standardized test results. Reni & Shantanu Narayen Scholarship
The Reni & Shantanu Narayen Scholarship was established to provide scholarships to students studying with the Department of Computer Science.
Eligibility:
Must be an undergraduate student;
Must be majoring in a degree program within the Department of Computer Science;
Must be a first generation college student;
Must demonstrate financial need as determined by FAFSA.
If no first generation student qualifies, preference should be given to a student who is from an ethnically diverse background and meets all the other criteria.
This scholarship is renewable. more...

Scholarship for college freshmen enrolled full-time at Ohio University majoring in Engineering. Students must come from a rural community or a small community that serves a rural community. First preference given to Lawrence County, Ohio; second preference given to Southeastern Ohio residents in the upper 20% of the graduating class, have a minimum 28 ACT score or 1100 SAT score, be members of the National Honor Society and participated in high student government or school athletic activities. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Robert U. Blaser Family Endowed Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending the University of Akron majoring in Physics and are members of the Honors Program. Selection based on academic achievement and potential. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Robert W. & Mildred Froelich Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Ashland University full-time, majoring in Instrumental Music. Applicant must have academic merit, future promise, high ethics and financial need. Financial need will not be the only determining factor. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Annual award for undergraduate student attending Ashland University full-time, who may have problems adjusting to the university and college life. Selection based on need for adjustment and help to turn toward brighter horizons. Students participation in athletics and financial need will also be considered but are not determining factors. Due date and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

Sidney A. Ribeau President's Leadership Academy
The Sidney A. Ribeau Presidents Leadership Academy (PLA) is a four-year leadership development program that engages scholars in classes, workshops, experiential learning, and community service activities. The curriculum focuses on specific outcomes, with each years experience building on those of the previous year.
Individuals selected to participate in PLA will receive a scholarship up to the cost of in-state instructional and general fees, for each year of eligibility. All monies must be applied directly to University charges. No refunds will be dispersed from PLA.
The Scholarship is renewable for a maximum of eight semesters of full-time enrollment (12-18 hours/semester). The Scholarship is only applied during Fall and Spring semesters.
Other Requirements:
Be accepted as a Bowling Green State University student prior to the PLA application deadline
Complete free application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form by January 15, 2022.
Must demonstrate financial need as determined by FAFSA.
Must demonstrate leadership and service during high school.
Only current high school seniors are eligible to apply. Applicants must graduate from high school by June 2022. more...

Sigma Beta Phi-Phi Kappa Psi (Last Mans Club) Scholarship
Scholarship for current Phi Kappa Psi members who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Toledo. Students must have a minimum 2.75 GPA, and demonstrate leadership skills, citizenship, and community involvement. New members of Phi Kappa Psi must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. A FAFSA must be submitted by April 1st. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Selection will be based on: 30% on 4-H leadership activities; 10% on 4-H honors received at county; 20% on 4-H project achievements and growth of 4-H activity and experience and 40% on one or two-page statement as to why a Vance Family 4-H Award would be important to you. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

William Delaney, Jr. Memorial Scholarship (B)
Scholarship for non-traditional undergraduate students enrolled part- or full-time at the University of Toledo College of Health Science and Human Service majoring in Corrections or Criminal Justice. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

William E. & Annie S. Miller Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for former Newark, Ohio students who are first-year students enrolling at Denison University. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

William E. Goos Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for an Ohio resident who is a high school senior and current 4-H member that is planning to enroll in the fall atThe Ohio State University main campus in Columbus in any area of study. Preference will be given to applicants from Butler, Preble and Hamilton counties (in that order). Selection will be based on: 10% for potential for success; 10% for financial need; 40% on 4-H leadership activities; 20% on major 4-H honors; 15% on 4-H community service/citizenship; 5% on personal 4-H story. Once awarded, winner may re-apply for additional Goos scholarship monies for a maximum of on year. more...

William F. Rohr Scholarship Fund In Engineering
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolled full-time at the University of Toledo majoring in Engineering. Students must demonstrate academic achievement, financial need, and be graduates of Woodward High School in Toledo, Ohio. A FAFSA must be submitted by April 1st. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

William F. Wahlert Memorial Fund Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Wright State University majoring in Industrial Systems or Mechanical Systems Engineering. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

William F. Worthington Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Ohio University Athens Campus. Students must be graduates of Perry County, Ohio high schools. Preference given to previous award recipients. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Annual award for Canadian citizens who are college seniors enrolled full-time at the University of Toledo majoring in Engineering. Students must demonstrate academic achievement, leadership skills, and be pursuing a career in mobility engineering. Nonrenewable. more...

The William G. Hodupp Memorial Scholarship is available to juniors and seniors majoring in finance or marketing at the University of Toledo. You must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and demonstrate both merit and financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and financial need. A FAFSA must be submitted by April 1st. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Wittenberg University Smith Scholar/University Scholar Award
Scholarship for undergraduate students who are attending Wittenberg University in Ohio. Selection is based on superior academic performance, co-curricular achievements, personal references, writing ability and SAT/ACT scores. Exceptional students not meeting this criteria may be considered by the Admission Committee. Award amount is equal to half or full-tuition. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable; maintain 3.5 GPA. more...

Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Selection based on academic achievement, completion of 28 credit hours at UA, financial need, potential and contribution to the department. Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled at Sinclair Community College. Applicants must be under 24 years of age, ineligible for financial aid OR dependent students unable to provide parental income information and unable to submit a FAFSA. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Proof of employment must be included with application packet. more...

World Missions Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate juniors or seniors attending Cedarville University in Ohio, majoring in Religious Studies and planning to enter full-time missions for a Christian organization. Preference given to students planning to enter the foreign mission field following graduation. Candidates must have demonstrated financial need, excel in missionary service and academic excellence. Applicants should complete the FAFSA application to qualify for this award. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Wright State Scholar
Scholarship for entering freshmen at Wright State University. Applicants must meet two of the following criteria: Minimum 3.75 GPA; rank in the top 10% of their class; or minimum 29 ACT score or 1300 SAT math and reading score. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Annual award for graduating high school seniors planning to attend Wright State University majoring in Engineering. Students must be U.S. citizens, and demonstrate academic achievement and scholarship. An essay must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable. more...

Scholarship for freshmen enrolling at Wright State University pursuing a degree in Engineering or a Math/Science field. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and have completed Wright STEPP summer program sessions. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Renewable. more...

Wsu Commended Scholarship
Scholarship for entering freshmen who are name Commended Scholars by National Achievement enrolling at Wright State University. Number of awards may vary. Award amount is in-state tuition. Renewable. more...

Wsu National Scholarship
Scholarship for entering freshmen who are National Achievement Finalist enrolling at Wright State University. Applicants must designate Wright State University as university of first choice. Number of awards may vary. Award amount is full-tuition, room, board and books. Renewable. more...

Youngstown-Warren Alumni Scholarship

Zahn Scholarship Competition
Annual competition in which Tiffin University conducts the Zahn Scholar examination consisting of vocabulary aptitude and critical thinking skills. The high school senior scoring the highest on the exam is awarded a full tuition scholarship for 4 years. Second through fifth place winners each receive a half tuition scholarship for 4 years. Applications for the examination and additional information are available from the Office of Admissions. more...

Zane State College Academic Award
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Zane State College who graduated from a high school in Muskingum, Guernsey or Noble counties, Ohio. Selection based on academic achievement, class rank in the top 25%, financial need, and recommendations. Recipients may reapply and compete annually. Applications are available at the Zane State Foundation office and the guidance offices of local high schools in Guernsey, Muskingum, or Noble counties. more...

Zanesville Deans Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Ohio University Zanesville Campus. Incoming freshmen should be class valedictorians, salutatorians, or rank in the top 15% of the graduating class, have a minimum 3.5 GPA, have a minimum 24 ACT score or minimum 1000 SAT score; current college students must have a minimum 3.3 GPA and have earned a minimum of 24 credit hours. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Zanesville Scholarship Endowment
Scholarship for Muskingum County, Ohio residents who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Ohio University. Students must demonstrate academic achievement. Consideration given to financial need. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...
